DatagramReceiver Class Reference

Socket to be used for receiving messages. More...

#include <DatagramSocket.h>

Collaboration diagram for DatagramReceiver:

[legend]
List of all members.

Public Types

  • enum PortChoice { GENERIC, REUSEADDR, FINDFREEPORT }
    The possible choices when creating a DatagramReceiver: {description} [GENERIC] ``Ordinary bind'' to the port [REUSEADDR] Set the { SO_REUSEADDR}-flag before binding the socket to allow several processes to use the same port, useful when running several modules on the same machine that should listen to the same multicast address [FINDFREEPORT] Tries to find a free port {description}. More...

Detailed Description

Socket to be used for receiving messages.

Definition at line 138 of file DatagramSocket.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DatagramReceiver::PortChoice
 

The possible choices when creating a DatagramReceiver: {description} [GENERIC] ``Ordinary bind'' to the port [REUSEADDR] Set the { SO_REUSEADDR}-flag before binding the socket to allow several processes to use the same port, useful when running several modules on the same machine that should listen to the same multicast address [FINDFREEPORT] Tries to find a free port {description}.

Enumeration values:
GENERIC 
REUSEADDR 
FINDFREEPORT 

Definition at line 153 of file DatagramSocket.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DatagramReceiver::DatagramReceiver (  uint16  port,
PortChoice  pc = GENERIC
) 
 

Parameters:
port The portnumber the socket uses
pc Optional parameter that sets the behavior when creating (and specially binding) the socket. Possible values and their meaning are listed by { PortChoice}
See also:
PortChoice

bool DatagramReceiver::getPeerName (  uint32 &  IP,
uint16 &  port
) 
 

Returns the IP-address and port of the last received packet.

Parameters:
IP Outparameter that is set to the IP-address of the last received packet.
port Outparameter that is set to the port of the last received packet.
Returns:
True if the IP and port contains valid data, false otherwise.

bool DatagramReceiver::joinGroup (  uint32  ip  ) 
 

Used to make this receiver join a multicast group.

Parameters:
ip The ip of the multicast group to join.
Returns:
True if joined group with ip, false otherwise.

int32 DatagramReceiver::receive (  byte *  buff,
uint32  buffSize,
uint32  micros
) 
 

Receives an UDP packet into buff with maxSize bbuffSize.

Parameters:
buff The buffer to write packet into.
buffSize The size of buff.
micros The max time to wait for a packet, in microseconds.
Returns:
Number bytes received. < 0 means error

bool DatagramReceiver::receive (  Packet *  packet,
uint32  micros
) 
 

Fill a Packet with data from the network.

This method hangs until any UDP is received or the time-out is reached.

Parameters:
packet The packet where the data will be inserted.
micros The maximum waittime for the UDP.
Returns:
True if data is inserted into the packet, false otherwise (probably time-out).

int32 DatagramReceiver::receive (  byte *  buff,
uint32  buffSize
) 
 

Receives an UDP packet into buff with maxSize bbuffSize.

Parameters:
buff The buffer to write packet into.
buffSize The size of buff.
Returns:
Number bytes received. < 0 means error

bool DatagramReceiver::receive (  Packet *  packet  ) 
 

Fill a Packet with data from the network.

This method hangs until any UDP is received.

Parameters:
packet The packet where the data will be inserted.
Returns:
True if data is inserted into the packet, false otherwise.

Member Data Documentation

struct sockaddr_in DatagramReceiver::m_peerAddr [private]
 

The address of the last received packet.

Is set to contain only zeros in constructor and before each receive.
